text: Have you noticed how some feeds look great in a mailbox-style reader while others don't. For example, feeds from Substack are good for mailbox readers because their items are titled essays and the full text is in the feed. But NYT feeds look terrible, as does Scripting News. The mailbox reader, which was popularized by Google Reader, is designed for titled full-text feeds. The NYT has titles on its feed items, but just a synopsis. There's so much wasted space in the display and it looks and feels unbalanced. I like whitespace, but that's not what this is. The NYT and Scripting work much better in a river-style display, which is the pattern that Twitter and Facebook use, for example. BTW, in my feed, some posts have titles, but the majority don't. A mailbox reader can't deal with untitled posts, I've given up on trying to make it work, it just doesn't.
